Chapter 1: Great Stirring and Moving, Chapter 1: Great Stirring and Moving, thus have I heard:
At one time, the World-Honored One was dwelling in the Dharma stillness site in the realm of Magadha.

Having just attained Buddhahood, his radiance was bright and shining, proclaiming the treasury of true reality, expounding the wisdom of the TathÄgata, revealing the essentials of the three times, and spreading the samÄdhi of the unobstructed treasure of the path.

At that time, the Buddha entered this samÄdhi of universal wisdom, which was boundless and suddenly still. The samÄdhi was tranquil, suddenly formless, neither inside nor outside, still without seeing or hearing. The samÄdhi he was dwelling in was vast and boundless, difficult to encounter and hear, encountered only once in many eons. At that time, he attained this samÄdhi.
The Buddha's samÄdhi was immeasurable, and nothing was not clearly penetrated. With his all-encompassing wisdom, he attained the power of universal wisdom.
Limitless purity, praising the TathÄgata, without a nest or dwelling, manifesting the Buddha's body.

Obtaining the great emptiness and tranquility, the subtle phrase, then extensively the Buddha's various movements, equal, without abiding, turning the wisdom practice, the name universally renowned in the world, glorifying the TathÄgata.

When it arises, it manifests the Buddha land, with its single characteristic, penetrating to the characteristic of non-existence, the characteristic of non-existence and non-action is also non-existent.
The majestic flame pervades, illuminating the ten directions, the unsurpassed Buddha's concentration, shining like this!
Extending to all lands, simultaneously manifesting transformations, all worlds, none are not amazed.
At that time, in the assembly there was a bodhisattva named Samantabhadra, who, receiving the Buddha's holy intent, thought to himself:
Today the TathÄgata's manifested transformations are something never heard or seen before since ancient times.
Such auspicious signs must have an extraordinary and inexhaustible essence, and should be made to be upheld by all the great bodhisattvas of other lands.
Then, in accordance with the image, he entered proper meditative absorption and emitted a great golden light that illuminated the lands of the ten directions.
Within the light, heavenly flowers and incense were scattered, and heavenly music was played. The music was gentle and harmonious, with a single great sound.

Shortly after, the great bodhisattvas,

At that time, the World-Honored One, with his great meditative absorption, penetrated all of them.

He saw the multitudes, none of whom did not have their delusions exhausted. Those who were born and those who ended, as well as their attainments and destructions, were all understood through his meditative absorption.

His vast and all-pervading samÄdhi penetrated all without exception. Observing the assembly that had come, they were all bodhisattvas, all great youths, MahÄsattvas, as numerous as the dust motes in the lands of the ten directions.
Their aspirations were all lofty and sublime, they walked alone and were extraordinary, they were all in the highest rank, and their investiture was unsurpassed.

They each abided in essential practices, their abodes were like the Buddha's, their power was unrivaled, and they were as fierce as lions.

He roams without companions, his majestic spirit uniquely revered, able to roar the great lion's roar in the ten directions.
With adamantine resolve, he shatters and crushes demonic enemies, subduing them with compassion, bringing them to submission through virtue alone.
He turns away the various non-Buddhist paths, advancing and retreating freely, with the correct thoughts of moral virtue, aiding and delivering all.

Such were the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas in the buddha-lands of the ten directions, as numerous as dust motes in the empty space, all of whom had fallen into the same state as Bodhisattva Doulou (Dharmodgata) and Bodhisattva Suliyan (Suddhodana), practicing together since ancient times, cultivating the virtues of bodhisattvas, and all endowed with complete virtues.

At that time, Bodhisattva Samantabhadra, receiving the Buddha's majestic spiritual power, suddenly rose from his seat, bared his right shoulder, touched his right knee to the ground, faced the World-Honored One with palms joined, and said to the World-Honored One:
I wish to ask the TathÄgata, the Perfectly Enlightened One, if I may be permitted, I will now speak out.
The Buddha told Samantabhadra:
Ask the TathÄgata whatever you wish.
The Buddha will follow your thoughts and explain for you, causing you to rejoice.
At that time, Samantabhadra immediately said to the Buddha:
How is it, World-Honored One!
How many inconceivable samÄdhis do bodhisattvas attain to accord with the practices of Bodhisattva Samantabhadra and reach equality with his heroic vows?
And the adornments and practices they cultivate, being self-mastered in samÄdhi and taking delight in it, using the power of samÄdhi to move and transform all samÄdhis?
May the TathÄgata explain and resolve this.
Then the World-Honored One said to Samantabhadra:
Excellent, excellent!
Samantabhadra Bodhisattva!
You are now expanding the Dharma assembly for the Buddhas, Bodhisattvas of the past, present, and future, and asking about the essential teachings!
If it is Samantabhadra,
the Bodhisattva Samantabhadra is now in this assembly, attaining the inconceivable Bodhisattva transformations, cultivating the immeasurable Bodhisattva practices;
attaining the inconceivable Bodhisattva transformations, already purifying the Bodhisattva's difficult-to-encounter vows.
Reaching the Bodhisattva's birth practices without turning back, cultivating the immeasurable pure practices of vast virtues, equaling and surpassing the immeasurable, with unobstructed eloquence.
With great compassion, being unwearied in the immeasurable;
with all vows, being undisturbed at the limits.
We should all invite him to explain the practice of entering various samÄdhis and transformations.

At that time, the assembly, hearing the name of that true person, all respectfully looked up, wanting to see Samantabhadra Bodhisattva but not seeing him, not hearing his words or where he was sitting.
Why was this so?
It was due to the spiritual power of the TathÄgata and the power of Samantabhadra Bodhisattva.
At that time, Samantabhadra Bodhisattva addressed the Buddha, saying:
Where is Samantabhadra Bodhisattva now?
The Buddha told him:
Samantabhadra Bodhisattva is in this assembly, moving and dwelling to the left and right of my knees.
At that time, Samantabhadra Bodhisattva and the great assembly used their spiritual powers to observe everywhere, but did not know where he was. They again addressed the Buddha, saying:
We do not see Samantabhadra Bodhisattva or his seat.
The World-Honored One told them:
So it is, son of noble family!
You all do not see Bodhisattva Samantabhadra's body or his seat.
Why is that?

It is because Bodhisattva Samantabhadra abides in profound practices and is unobtainable. With his unobstructed wisdom, he attains the strength and ferocity of a lion. He attains the Buddha's unsurpassed transformation, the realm of quiescent non-obstruction, and abides in the treasury of the Buddha's ten powers and Dharma realm. He achieves the Buddha's majestic spiritual power, the wisdom of adornment without destruction, and the equality of the three times. The pure single-minded realm of Bodhisattva Samantabhadra is the Dharma body of all Buddhas.

At that time, Bodhisattva Samantabhadra, in the presence of the TathÄgata, heard of Bodhisattva Samantabhadra's virtuous practices, cultivated the ten samÄdhis of a bodhisattva, and all wished to see Bodhisattva Samantabhadra, thinking of him and searching for him.
Bodhisattva Samantabhadra and the entire assembly did not see Bodhisattva Samantabhadra at all.
At that time, Bodhisattva Samantabhadra arose from his samÄdhi and addressed the Buddha, saying:

The Buddha told Samantabhadra:

You do not see Bodhisattva Samantabhadra.
Why is it so?
He has already studied the inexhaustible ground of bodhisattva practices.
Moreover, Samantabhadra!
In the illusory words of illuminating wisdom, can one distinguish illusory form with wisdom?
He said:
No, one cannot.
World-Honored One!
The illusory cannot be distinguished.
How much less can one see the body, speech, or mind of Bodhisattva Samantabhadra and enter his realm?
Why is it so?
Because his profound and inconceivable virtues are complete, and because he expounds the inexhaustible with immeasurable [means], he has attained the wisdom of the vajra.
In brief, they understand the immeasurable nature and realm of phenomena, and are unattached to any buddha-land;
Regarding all bodies, they understand that they have no substance, no practice, no entry, and no existent dharmas, and so forth.

The realm of the supernormal powers of the self is indestructible, and there is no attachment to the various abodes, no attachment to wealth, and through supernormal powers, one understands that originally there is nothing.

If you wish to see Bodhisattva Samantabhadra, there is no obstruction in seeing him, no obstruction in hearing him, no obstruction in paying homage to him, no obstruction in respectfully thinking of him, no obstruction in mentally recollecting him, no obstruction in approaching him, no obstruction in seeing him, no obstruction in cultivating entry to him, and no obstruction in seeking him. The aspirations of Bodhisattva Samantabhadra are without any bondage or obstruction.
At that time, Bodhisattva Equal Eyes and the assembly of bodhisattvas all yearned to see Bodhisattva Samantabhadra. They all joined their palms together and said to the crown of his head:
We take refuge in the buddhas and take refuge in Samantabhadra.

Then the World-Honored One said to Samantabhadra:

Look in all directions, with your clear eyes, right within your body, seeking for Samantabhadra;

You should single-mindedly face Bodhisattva Samantabhadra;
You should understand the realm of original non-existence, and cause the self of the body to be established in all lands;
You should discern all faculties, causing them to reach everywhere, and forever attain Samantabhadra.
Those who practice like this will see Samantabhadra.
At that time, Bodhisattva Samantabhadra and the great assembly, hearing from the World-Honored One, immediately bowed their heads in reverence, and all invited Samantabhadra.

In the time it takes to invite, Samantabhadra Bodhisattva caused a great stir, causing the entire assembly to see Samantabhadra sitting on a great lotus flower to the left and right of the World-Honored One's feet.
The bodies of all the bodhisattvas in this assembly appeared within him;
In all the lands, there was none who did not see him. The Buddhas of the past and future saw each other in the universal lands. The Buddha's voice expounded the wisdom of the three times.
At that time, the equal-eyed one and the assembly of bodhisattvas, seeing this transformation, were all delighted and joyfully made obeisance to Samantabhadra.

At that time, by the Buddha's majestic spiritual power and also due to Samantabhadra Bodhisattva's past virtues, heavenly flowers rained down, falling in profusion. Heavenly necklaces and musical instruments such as konghou resonated in harmony. Heavenly rain and fragrant dew spread throughout the Buddha's realm. In the sky, there was the sound of heavenly phoenixes. The three evil destinies all took a break at the same time.
The assembly of innumerable great liberated bodhisattvas immediately all understood the virtues and practices of Samantabhadra Bodhisattva.
At that time, Samantabhadra Bodhisattva said to the Buddha:

The virtues of this Samantabhadra Bodhisattva are immeasurable and limitless, with boundless practices, uninterrupted practices, unceasing practices, universally flowing practices, reaching everywhere, practices without turning back, discerning all dharmas, practices without discrimination, following all skillful means, and equal to the practices beyond words.
The World-Honored One said:
It is so!
Samantabhadra!
It is as you have said.

Samantabhadra Bodhisattva purifies innumerable beings, with ultimate purity and immeasurable merit, creating innumerable blessings, cultivating innumerable characteristics, virtues beyond measure, practices without equal, and fame spreading everywhere.
The practice of non-attainment universally benefits the three times, with the renown of the Buddha universally flowing and being known.
The achievements of Samantabhadra Bodhisattva are like this.

The body of an Asura king is seven hundred yojanas long, and by his spiritual powers he manifests a body six hundred and eighty thousand yojanas long.
